items.name: Major Scale (Ionian)
items.description: The most fundamental scale in Western music. Also known as the Ionian mode.
items.details: The major scale consists of 7 notes with the pattern: W-W-H-W-W-W-H (W=whole step, H=half step). It's the basis for major keys and is widely used in all genres.

items.name: Natural Minor Scale (Aeolian)
items.description: The relative minor to the major scale. Also called the Aeolian mode.
items.details: The natural minor scale has 7 notes with the pattern: W-H-W-W-H-W-W. It's the minor scale most used in classical and popular music.

items.name: Harmonic Minor Scale
items.description: A minor scale with a raised 7th degree, creating a leading tone.
items.details: Pattern: W-H-W-W-H-W+H-H. The raised 7th creates a leading tone that resolves to the root, making it useful for harmony but creating a distinctive sound.

items.name: Melodic Minor Scale
items.description: A minor scale with raised 6th and 7th degrees in ascending order.
items.details: Ascending: W-H-W-W-W-W-H. Descending: natural minor pattern. Used in classical melodies and jazz improvisation.

items.name: Major Pentatonic Scale
items.description: A 5-note major scale with the 4th and 7th degrees removed.
items.details: Pattern: W-W-W+H-W-W+H (5 notes). Very melodic and commonly used in folk music, blues, and contemporary music.

items.name: Minor Pentatonic Scale
items.description: A 5-note scale based on the natural minor with the 2nd and 6th degrees removed.
items.details: Pattern: W+H-W-W-W+H-W (5 notes). Essential for blues, rock, and contemporary music. Very singable and expressive.

items.name: Blues Scale
items.description: A minor pentatonic with an added flat 5 (blue note).
items.details: The 6-note scale includes the characteristic 'blue note' (flat 5). Used extensively in blues, rock, and jazz.

items.name: Harmonic Major Scale
items.description: A major scale with a flattened 6th degree.
items.details: Pattern: W-W-H-W-H-W+H-H. Rare but distinctive sound, combining major brightness with minor darkness. Used in jazz and some classical works.

items.name: Whole Tone Scale
items.description: A 6-note scale with all intervals being whole steps (no half steps).
items.details: Pattern: W-W-W-W-W-W. Creates an ambiguous, unsettling sound with no traditional tonal center. Used in impressionist classical music and avant-garde jazz.
examples: Unique property: Only two unique whole tone scales exist (enharmonically equivalent)

items.name: Phrygian Dominant Scale
items.description: A scale combining Phrygian mode's flat 2nd with a major 3rd (V mode of harmonic minor).
items.details: Pattern: H-W-W-W-H-W+H-W. Creates Spanish and Flamenco sounds. Also called Spanish Phrygian or 5th mode of harmonic minor.
examples: E Phrygian dominant (from A harmonic minor): E-F-G#-A-B-C-D
Common in Flamenco guitar and Spanish music

items.name: Diminished Scale (Octatonic)
items.description: An 8-note scale alternating between whole and half steps.
items.details: Two variations: W-H-W-H-W-H-W-H (whole-half) or H-W-H-W-H-W-H-W (half-whole). Creates symmetrical, unsettling sound. Used in jazz and classical music.
examples: Used over diminished chords and passing chords

items.name: Augmented Scale
items.description: A 6-note scale alternating between minor thirds and half steps.
items.details: Pattern: W+H-H-W+H-H-W+H (6 notes). Creates an exotic, unsettling sound. Symmetric and mysterious. Used in advanced jazz improvisation.
examples: Used over augmented chords and dominant structures

items.name: Altered Scale (Super Locrian)
items.description: The 7th mode of melodic minor, containing all chromatic alterations.
items.details: Pattern: H-W-H-W-W-W-W. Contains both flat-9, sharp-9, flat-5, and sharp-5. Essential for jazz improvisation over altered dominant chords.
examples: B altered (from C melodic minor): B-C-D-Eb-F-G-A
Most alterations possible in a single scale

items.name: Mixolydian Flat 6 (Hindu Scale)
items.description: A Mixolydian mode with a lowered 6th degree, creating a darker major sound.
items.details: Pattern: W-W-H-W-H-W+H-W. Also known as Hindu scale or Ultralocrian. Less common but creates beautiful modal textures.
examples: Found in various world music traditions

items.name: Neapolitan Minor Scale
items.description: A natural minor scale with a raised 7th degree, combining both minors.
items.details: Pattern: W-H-W-W-H-W+H-H. Unique scale combining characteristics of natural minor and harmonic minor.
examples: Used in classical and romantic music
